metadata.title: Differentially Private Robust Low-Rank Approximation
metadata.author: Raman Arora, Vladimir braverman, Jalaj Upadhyay
metadata.abstract: In this paper, we study the following robust low-rank matrix approximation problem: given a matrix A 2 Rn⇥d, find a rank-k matrix B, while satisfying differential privacy, such that kA Bkp

We study the related problem of differentially private robust principal component analysis (PCA), wherein we return a rank-k projection matrix ⇧ such that kA A⇧kp

We study the related problem of differentially private robust principal component analysis (PCA), wherein we return a rank-k projection matrix ⇧ such that kA A⇧kp
We extend Algorithm 2 to an "-locally-differentially private protocol, LOCAL-ROBUST-PCA, where every user 1
We present differentially private algorithms for robust low-rank approximation and for robust principal component analysis
summary: Low rank matrix approximation is a well studied problem, where given a data matrix A the goal is to find a low-rank matrix B that approximates A, in the sense that μ(A B) is small under some measure μ(·).
The focus of this paper, is to compute a low-rank approximation of a given matrix under a strong privacy guarantee while being robust to outliers in data.
We give the first timeand space-efficient differentially private algorithm for low-rank matrix approximation with respect to entrywisep-norm.
We formally define the problem of differentially private robust low-rank matrix approximation, and state our main results.
Our first contribution is Algorithm 1, ROBUST-LRA, which given an input matrix A 2 Rn⇥d returns a differentially private rank-k approximation to A with a multiplicative approximation factor of ↵ =
We give an (", )-differentially private polynomial-time algorithm for robust low-rank approximation.

Most existing non-private algorithms for robust low-rank approximation either use heuristics and do not have provable guarantees, or they make additional assumptions on the input matrix; the only exception is the work of Song et al [29].
Note that the private matrix is stored only in the form of linear sketches, to get an algorithm in the general turnstile streaming model, we initialize Yr = N1, Yc = N2, and Z = N3.

Algorithm ROBUST-LRA is an (", )-differentially private that on input a private matrix A in a general turnstile update model, outputs a rank k matrix M with the same accuracy guarantee as in Theorem 10.

For outputting a low-rank approximation in the continual release model, we can use the generic transformation to store a binary tree that is constructed over the sketches of the updates as its leaves [12].
Algorithm ROBUST-LRA is an (", )-differentially private algorithm that on input matrix A in a streaming manner, runs in time poly(k, n, d, log T ) and outputs a rank k matrix

K kA Xkp, it runs in time poly(k, n, d), space Oe(k(n + d)), and outputs a rank k orthonormal projection matrix ⇧ such that, with probability 9/10 over the random coin tosses of the algorithm, kA A⇧kp
We present differentially private algorithms for robust low-rank approximation and for robust principal component analysis.
We study extensions of our algorithms to a continual release model, the streaming model of computation, and the local model of differential privacy.

Song et al [29] show that if the exponential time hypothesis is true, any linear-sketch based polynomial time algorithm for robust rank-k factorization incurs an ⌦(k1/2 ) multiplicative approximation for some 2 (0, 0.5) that can be arbitrarily small.
headline: We study the following robust low-rank matrix approximation problem: given a matrix A 2 Rn⇥d, find a rank-k matrix B, while satisfying differential privacy, such that kA Bkp
